msbt.message: Are you out for a walk too, my dear?I enjoy relaxing at home, but I find fresh air and exercise essential to maintaining my youthful glow.

When I'm out for a leisurely stroll like this, I tend to think about all the things I need to do when I get home. But by the time I get homeI'm so relaxed from being out in the fresh air, I don't get a single thing done!
I hear green spaces are all the rage in urban design. Even busy business hubs are getting a splash of nature. You know, it's like I always say "Green is gorgeous!"

Why, what mysterious force has brought us together in a place like this. Strange, don't you think? And to have bumped into such a dear friend Surely it's fate!Or perhaps I'm just being a bit dramatic. Sometimes I can't help myself.
Getting out for a walk like thisit's good for the body and for the mind, you know. Your feet may be moving, but your brain goes on a journey all its own. It's most invigorating, .

You can learn a great deal about a someone by looking at their home, don't you think? The color, the furniture, the knick- knacksthey say SO much.What does my home say about me?<10_4 /> Why, it says, " has fabulous taste!"

Darling, have you ever been inside 's home?I must say, I was rather surprised when I stopped by. interior design style is sounusual. I'm not quite sure what to call it. Bohemian industrial? Victorian art deco? Gothic country? Perhaps we should just call it "classic ."
It's important to select the PERFECT spot when building a home. Location, location, location! It's everything. And look! You've done it! This place is fabulous. Even I'd be happy living here.

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />I love how little your house is, ! It's adorable!<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Tiny houses are charming and ALL the rage. But, darling, you can fit so much more<10_5 />STUFF in a big one!
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Why, , you've expanded your home, haven't you, ?At this size, it's big enough to live in comfortably, but not so big that cleaning it is a burden.

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Ooooh, I see you've got TWO rooms in your house! How luxurious!<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />I have to ask What do you use the second room for? A bedroom? A kitchen? A bathroom? I know! It's the room you keep all your designer shoes in! Well, that's what I would use it for, .
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Oh my! Will you look at that! Your home has three rooms.I like how it gives the exterior that, umasymmetric look. A bold choice, .

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />What a large home you have! There are so many rooms. Why, you should rent one out to me!<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Oh, don't you worry. That was just a little joke. We're not roommate material just yet, .

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Oh my, , you've added a second floor to your house. Excellent choice, my dear. I approve.Though you'll have to walk up and down stairs all the time now.<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />, it's going to be exhausting But your calves will look marvelous!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />I see you've added a basement to your abode, .<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />If you don't mind my asking what ARE you doing down there?? ? Listening to music? <20_3 arg="6" />You don't HAVE to answerbut I have a vivid imagination and a big mouth, .

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />It would seem 's "house" is a tent. I mean, it's an adorable tent, but still <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />I do realize that is the adventurous sort and enjoys communing with nature and whatnot. It's just I, myself, prefer something a little moreplush. Ah well, to each their own, .

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />'s house is quite small, isn't it?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Oh, don't get me wrong, it's very nice! Very !Like I'm always sayingit's not how big a house is, it's how much love you put inside it, .

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />I see 's house is really quite large. I'm positively green with envy! <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />If I had that much space, I'd finally have SOMEWHERE to put my extensive furniture collection. Now that I really think about it, , I may need even MORE room to fit it all.

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Well, well! 's house is coming along nicely, I see. It has an extra room! <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Do you know what it looks like on the inside? I'm simply dying to know, . I know! Let's drop by for a visit so we can see what has done with the place!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />My goodness, 's house is quite large. How much bigger will it get, I wonder? <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />If it continues expanding at this pace, someone might get lost in there one day, .

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_3 arg="3" />'s house has four rooms. FOUR! I hate to admit it, but part of me is green with envy. <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Of course, the other part of me does NOT envy all the cleaning has to do!
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />'s house has a second story, you know.<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />I do love my cozy little home. But I confess, I wouldn't mind expanding my horizons, !

Did you hear, ? 's house now has a basement! <20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />There were plenty of rooms to begin with, but now there's one you can't even see from the outside! <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />What on EARTH is it used for? I just KNOW is hosting a book club down there without me!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Did you know Timmy has a shop in Tom Nook's tent?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />It may not stock the widest selection, but everything he sells is useful for those of us living here on the island. Honestly, I fear we'd be lost without it, .
Nook's Cranny doesn't have a huge inventory yet. Still, I do enjoy shopping there. It's because of Timmy's and Tommy's superb customer service. They know how to make patrons feel welcome.

I always end up at Nook's Cranny. There's a lovely variety of items to choose from, and they change daily. Little Timmy and Tommy are very savvy business raccoons as well.When they recommend an item with those adorable smiles, I can't possibly say no, .

I hear Blathers is planning to build a museum. A museum on an island How wonderfully sophisticated! <20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Althoughfrom the looks of it, he hasn't made much progress. <20_2 arg="6" />Too busy with his research, perhaps? <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Well, we should all pitch in and help poor Blathers out. The museum must go on, !

Do you have business at Resident Services or are you just stopping by to see Isabelle? I tell you, she is SO easy to talk to, not to mention surprisingly wise.I drop by all the time just to ask her for advicenot that I need it, of course! I just want to make sure someone is keeping her company, .

Ah, , are you off to visit another island? Or perhaps you're here to meet a friend? So many hellos and goodbyes take place at the airport. And SO much romantic intrigue! Me? I, umm I'm just here to send a postcard, silly. What else would I be doing?
Folks love hanging out at the plaza. If you feel like chatting, darling, it's a good place to spend time.
Aren't these paving stones absolutely fabulous?The plaza is the public face of the island, after all, so of course we want it to look its best!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />My goodness, , I simply can't walk past the tailors without stopping inside for a look! <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Fabulous items rotate through every day, and the sisters have impeccable taste. I find the place irresistible!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Why, it looks like a new house is going up I wonder what our new neighbor will be like, ? <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />I do enjoy meeting new residents, but it can be a bit unnerving. Will I like them? Will they like ME? Well, everyone has been delightful so far. I'm sure our new neighbor will be perfectly lovely as well.

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />I love the dignified atmosphere of a museum, don't you, ?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Walking in this hushed space filled to the brim with all manner of knowledgeit's quite humbling.

Have you noticed that the museum's fish gallery plays the sound of popping bubbles? I find it SO soothing, my dear. It's silly, butI can't help but wonder if I was a fish in a past life. In my dreams, I'm gliding through the water. It's just lovely.

, do you go to the museum's bug gallery very often?Did you know the bugs aren't locked up in cages? They're allowed to roam free in a natural environment instead. Butis it secure? Whenever I see , I can't help but want to catch it!
My stars, have you seen the in the museum's fossil gallery?!What an awe-inspiring relic it is! Just imagine what the ancient world must have been like.

What an honor it is to lay eyes upon the great works of art found in the museum, . The , for example The mastery! The majesty! The magnificence! Well, I'm sure YOU understand. Sophisticated folks such as ourselves can't help but be enthralled.
